decks.notes: The main focus of this UW Control deck is to counter and control the opponent's actions through counterspells like Dovin's Veto and Absorb, board wipes like Supreme Verdict, and card draw manipulation with Memory Deluge and Meticulous Archive. The deck also includes some disruptive elements like Get Lost and Hallowed Moonlight to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The win condition is to outvalue the opponent with card advantage, protect key threats like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and eventually close out the game with powerful finishers like Shark Typhoon and The Wandering Emperor.

The deck is built around the powerful card advantage engine of Niv-Mizzet Reborn, using a wide range of multicolored cards to ensure maximum value from his ability. The inclusion of Bring to Light allows for versatile answers to a variety of threats, while control elements like Vanishing Verse and Leyline Binding help control the board. The companion Yorion provides additional value with flicker effects, and the mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multicolored requirements effectively. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol opponents through its diverse range of card options.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cast spells that can trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck includes a variety of low-cost spells like Consider, Lightning Axe, and Opt to help fill the graveyard and bring back the Phoenix. The deck also includes cards like Treasure Cruise and Hall of Storm Giants to provide card advantage and finish off opponents quickly. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and capitalize on the powerful recursion ability of Arclight Phoenix.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through targeted discard spells like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and deep-cavern Bat, while also utilizing graveyard recursion with Cling to Dust and Graveyard Trespasser. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and card advantage, while Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal can help close out the game. The deck also includes lands that provide utility, such as Field of Ruin and Castle Locthwain.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring Arclight Phoenix back from the graveyard for aggressive attacks. It also includes support cards like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to control the board and allow for quick wins. The inclusion of cards like Opt and Consider help to dig for key pieces while Treasure Cruise provides card advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Ashiok, Dream Render and Spell Pierce to disrupt opponents' strategies. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and efficient spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Discover mechanic to find combo pieces that synergize well together. By playing cards like Beanstalk Giant and Greater Tanuki, you can generate additional value and mana to help you set up powerful plays. Leyline Binding and Quintorius Kand provide control options to protect your combo pieces, while cards like Release to the Wind and Spark Double offer flexibility in how you can approach your win condition. Overall, the deck aims to create explosive turns and overwhelm your opponent with a powerful combo strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with Rakdos color combination, utilizing cards that can quickly attack the opponent and deal damage efficiently. It includes a mixture of creatures, removal spells, and support cards to maintain pressure on the opponent throughout the game. The deck aims to establish board presence early on, disrupt the opponent's strategy with hand disruption spells, and close out the game with powerful finishers like Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord and Vein Ripper. The inclusion of cards like Mutavault and Smuggler's Copter adds versatility and evasion to the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on using the Transmogrify combo to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield. The goal is to quickly ramp into Transmogrify and use it to swap out a less powerful creature for a game-winning threat like Mirrex or Reckoner Bankbuster. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells to control the board and protect the combo. Jegantha, the Wellspring acts as a companion to provide additional mana fixing. The key strategy is to efficiently set up the combo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost creatures like Bishop of Wings and Righteous Valkyrie to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Collected Company and Skyclave Apparition for extra utility and removal options. With a mix of lifegain and creatures that benefit from gaining life, this deck aims to be aggressive while also maintaining board presence and control. The addition of cards like Charming Prince and Giada, Font of Hope offer flexibility and additional value in various situations.
